intro: Pycnandra filipes, commonly known as the slender pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories. The botanical features of Pycnandra filipes make it an important species in ecological studies of tropical flora.
